## Naive Bayes classifier

Calculate the following conditional probabilities. P(A/+), P(B/+), P(C/+), P(A/-), P(B/-), P(C/-). We start by calculating the probabilities of a record classified either in class + and -.
\newline
$$ P(+) = \frac{1}{2}, P(-) = \frac{1}{2} $$ 
\newline
$$ P(A = 1 | +) = {3}/{5}, P(A = 1 | -) = \frac{2}{5} $$
$$ P(B = 1 | +) = \frac{1}{5}, P(B = 1 | -) = \frac{2}{5} $$ 
$$ P(C = 1 | +) = \frac{4}{5}, P(C = 1 | -) = \frac{5}{5} $$
$$ P(X|+)P(+) = P(A|+)P(B|+)P(C|+)P(+) = \frac{2}{5} \frac{1}{5} \frac{4}{5} \frac{1}{2} = 0.048 $$
$$ P(X|-)P(-) = P(A|-)P(B|-)P(C|-)P(-) = \frac{2}{5} \frac{2}{5} \frac{5}{5} \frac{1}{2} = 0.02 $$

Estimate class for sample (A=0, B=1, C=0)
$$ P(X)=P(A=0)P(B=1)P(C=0) $$
$$ P(X)=\frac{1}{2} \frac{3}{10} \frac{9}{10} = 0.054 $$
$$ \frac{P(X|+) P(+)}{P(X)} = \frac{0.048}{0.054} = 0.88 $$
$$ \frac{P(X|-) P(-)}{P(X)} = \frac{0.02}{0.054} = 0.37 $$
Thus, the sample is classified to class "+".
